Reviews.Title: “Baby friendly- so helpful”
Reviews.Author: JMF5114
Reviews.Content: Hi- I adopted a baby, and stayed at the hotel during interstate adoption process. The staff was so friendly and helpful, it made it so stress free for me. They even ran errands for me, helped with set up of the crib and stroller, and generally were over the top friendly. I will always have fond memories of the Residence Inn and the friendly staff. They should be the official adoption hotel. Wireless connection made it easy to conduct business, they faxed for me, really made it so easy for me to stay here for a week. Laundry was so helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Hkloban
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a typical Residence Inn which means a nice room at a good price. The free breakfast was quite good and the staff working in that area provided excellent service. The front desk staff gave us good options for local dining which was most appreciated. There was an ice storm the morning we left and the staff was right on top of it. The area was salted and cleaned right away. The front desk staff sent a log to our room for our fireplace which was a nice touch. I would definately go back to this lovely city and this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: LoriMountJoy_PA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a month while my daughter was a patient at the University of Pennsylvania Hospital. The location was absolutely perfect as well as the accommodations. It only took 12 -15 minutes to get to the hospital even in the morning traffic. They offer a discounted rate for patient's families. The rooms were kept very clean and maintained very well. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I couldn't have ask for anything more. Breakfast was perfect and in the evening they had dinner available at no charge. Angela was a very good manager as well. I was in the office in the morning and she had everyone together and shared any positive remarks from the customers as well as any complaints. She was a definite motivator. I would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “worst ever”
Reviews.Author: mike887755
Reviews.Content: Terrible!!! Dirty. Not maintained. Old, not updated. Looks like sprawling old apartment complex. drawers in bathroom falling apartment. old kitchen appliances. grass needs cutting. hedges need trimming. food is bad. NO WIRELESS Internet connection!!!!!!!!!!! Filthy laundry room. Sign to entrance is burned out and end up driving past it at night. More like an old Howard Johnson's or Day's Inn. Been here five days and moving ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “needs some help”
Reviews.Author: jimTampaFlorida
Reviews.Content: have stayed in residence inns across the nation and this one rates at the bottom of list. rooms and parking are ok but Management, (whoever that is) needs to look around. the whole month there, 1. hot tub with out of order sign and full of dirt. and still is 2. Gas grill supposed to be in yard for usage, Was not. and is not 3. the whole month had to eat in the dimly lit dining room. help would not turn on lights or would say they were broke, but some days they in the day time they would be on. 4. grass was cut one time the whole time we stayed. 5. night time help very unfriendly. 6. passage ways fairly dirty and trash left sitting around. 7. evening food is nothing compared to other residence inns. overall lack of interest by management.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at Residence Inn Philadephia Airport”
Reviews.Author: KailuaGal
Reviews.Content: My husband, two children (15 and 12 yrs. old), and I stayed at the Residence Inn Philadelphia Airport for 2 nights in June 2011. We reserved a 2-bedroom suit with pull-out sofa. The room was very nice and roomy and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast was good, though, I wish they served bacon strips instead of the round ham patties. The room rate was very reasonable for a family of four; especially considering it included free parking, breakfast buffet, and evening receptions. It was also only a short drive to downtown Philadelphia. So, we used this location to visit some of Philadelphiaâ€™s historic sites like Independence Hall, Todd & Bishop White Houses, the Liberty Bell Center, Betsy Ross House, and National Constitution Center. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: purt1015
Reviews.Content: Our flight from Miami landed at 12:45 am. We had been in Curacao for a week long vacation. Given the late hour, we'd planned to stay in a hotel and head home the next morning. It was close to 2am when we arrived at the hotel. The gentleman who checked us in was pleasant and the studio room was very nice, much bigger than we expected. The foam mattress was one of the most comfortable beds I've every slept on. No transfer of motion. The hotel was very quiet, even in the morning. Standard Residence Inn breakfast, which I always enjoy. Friendly staff provided excellent directions for us to head back to New England. As airport hotels go, this is a very good one.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected stay with pleasant outcome”
Reviews.Author: hilll05
Reviews.Content: My flight was cancelled on 2/25. I chose Marriott Residence Inn at random. The customer service made a difficult experience worth while. The front desk, security and shuttle driver were attentive, polite and went the extra mile. The room was clean with brand new televisions and appliances. I would come again and highly recommend them. It takes 5 minutes from front desk to airport check-in.

Reviews.Title: “The staff keeps me coming back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: exdoublexx
Reviews.Content: I spend a lot of time in Philadelphia on business and can stay in any number of hotels. But it is the people here - particularly the kitchen staff - that keeps me coming back to this hotel. The rooms are clean as expected, and the amenities are what you would expect from a business hotel. The plus here is that they cook dinner for you 3 nights a week - and it is GOOD FOOD! Located on the perimeter of the airport, and the soundproofing isn't always the best. But the beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - clean and very good upkeep”
Reviews.Author: FormsanRunner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for one night last week. The hotel staff (front desk) were very helpful, gave us directions to shopping and the best Philly Cheese steak sandwich in town. The price we paid through priceline were excellent. Rooms were spacious and clean, the town house setting and full kitchen made us feel like home. Strongly recommend for weary travellers. In the morning, we saw workers fixing the roofs, that tells you the management does look after this property. Free parking is rare in Philly area. Fast internet access and complimentary breakfast were plus. The staff who look after breakfast were so friendly and eager to help. Hotel is a bit hard to find thouh. Need bigger sign in the front.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy space close to Philadelphia City Center”
Reviews.Author: cardtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit hard to find among the airport highway exits. Once you get there the rooms are great and luxurious although the bathrooms are a bit small. Seasonal pool is available. Great breakfast included in the room rate. Large ktichen. 3 TV's in a 2 bedroom suite. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy & bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: travelbugs1820
Reviews.Content: We were there from Friday 7/3 to 7/5/09 in room 211. Starting at around 10pm on our first night (7/3), the couple across the hall from us started arguing and slamming their door. We could actually hear them word for word because they were loud and stood right in the hall. Finally around midnight, we called the front desk to complain. The front desk person said sheâ€™s sending someone. About 5 minutes later, there was a knock on our door, the security guard wanted to know if everything was ok because thereâ€™s a complaint. We told him that we were the ones that complained! Five minutes later, he knocked on our door again wanted us to point out the people that we were complaining about. This wouldâ€™ve been ok if it wasnâ€™t for the fact that the lady that was making all the noises was standing right there in the hall way. Her spouse took off as soon as the security guard came around. Of course it shouldnâ€™t have taken a genius to figure out who these people were since they were standing right there in the hall way and a guy jumped into his car and took off. The security guard went back to the front desk without really doing anything except disturbing us even more. About an hour later, the guy returned and the arguing continued until 3 in the morning. This time, we just put up with it because it was better than the alternative. At the same time, we could hear every single foot step, water running, toilet flushing, and movements from the room right above our room (#211). At least we didnâ€™t have to hear people yelling and cursing at each other on our second night. Regardless, we didnâ€™t have much rest due the noises from the second floor. On top of that, there were other problems: the ice maker didnâ€™t work in our refrigerator; front desk receptionists were very unfriendly; and the plumbing back up so there were always debris in our tub. We couldnâ€™t place a formal complaint since the manager was off that whole weekend (or at least thatâ€™s what we were told). Weâ€™re always staying at the Marriott chain hotels, and usually are happy; but this location is the worst. We will never stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay. very simple.”
Reviews.Author: kianaplace
Reviews.Content: I had 3 days in Philadelphia before a loong direct flight home ( already knowing the Northwest Airlines Airbus A330 has all its seats occupied and no room to stretch in the plane ). The Residence Inn turned out to be a good stay. The location was easy to find and a 5 minute drive to the airport. Ive been to smaller cities than Philadelphia and the driving and Airport Hotel properties are just harder to find. The majority of the Airport hotels in Philadelphia are clustered in 2 areas near the airport. Adjacent to my property was the Sheraton Suites, 4 points, and Hilton. The Residence Inn looks like an apartment complex with 2 levels in an suburban neighborhood. The front office staff were nice but could have been more approachable. Even if the front desk staff tried to be more Service oriented, most people would think the staff would need more training. The lobby was clean and there was no sitting area unless you go into the cafeteria where they serve breakfast. An Internet terminal is right in the smack middle of the lobby where everyone can see what you are searching or purchasing online. Complimentary coffee is readily available in the lobby. I had a Suite on the first level in Building 14. Even though the property itself looked safe, the police was frequently roaming the parking lot talking to employees 2 of the 3 days I was there. There is also a Security Guard that walks the property constantly. The room was pretty basic. I was hoping to have a separate bed room from the kitchen/ living room area. But everything was squished in 1 big room. The shower and toilet in the bathroom is very small. It was hard to maneuver in there. The bed and Free parking was the best thing about this stay. Very soft multiple pillows made sleeping very comfortable. Overall, I would probably not come back to stay here. I paid $ 155.00 per night and it was not worth it. I had friends staying at the Quality Hotel ( not INN ) off of I 95 and they payed $ 65.00 for an economy style hotel and I felt it worth the price. This Quality Hotel was an older property with very friendly service and an average room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: yellow bus driver
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night while touring Philadelphia...great location, only minutes to downtown.. room very nice, extremely clean, breakfast was more than you could ask for.. Front desk very helpful with recommendations. would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay for business traveler”
Reviews.Author: bojette
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in March '08. Convenient to the airport, downtown, and Boeing complex. Complimentary breakfast was nice touch. It includes waffles, fruit, yogurt, bagels, cereal, etc. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. Room included den, kitchen area. Very spacious. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great place for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: acaciaruth
Reviews.Content: basically at the airport, close to downtown. large apartment style rooms with full kitchens. great breakfast included with room. free airport shuttle. pool was empty when we were there. nice enough to hold my bags for an extra 5 days after i checked out for FREE.

Reviews.Title: “I coming back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gpresident
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay, the room was nice and clean. The staff was very pleasant, the check in & out was quick. I was very please and supurise with the breakfast they ofter us. I am planning to go back really soon. I also need to say I am a very hard person to please. Thank you Gracie President New York

Reviews.Title: “great airport location”
Reviews.Author: 2toots
Reviews.Content: Our studio suite was very spacious with a sofa and armchair. As with all Residence Inn's, there was a full kitchen. Large closet and plenty of drawer space. Our bathroom vanity drawers had seen better days, but were clean. 2 huge windows in the room, one with a window that you could open. Had some problems with the internet. We faced a parking lot--not much of a view. They had a recyclable basket in the kitchen...great idea! Mangers reception offered chili and pirogies (odd combo). Breakfast was as always, very plentiful--something for everyone. All rooms offer exterior entry. This is a 2 story hotel with no elevators. Reminds me more of an apartment complex then a hotel. Nice meandering walkways. Outdoor pool and basketball court located near the main building (building 1) which also houses an small exercise room. Business center was a computer and printer in the lobby on a stand, no desk. There was always a security guard walking around, not sure why....?? The area is next to an airport--not many things to do. Convenient to highway. Center of Philly was about 20 minutes away--found driving around Philly to be confusing, thank goodness for Garmin! Within walking distance to the hotel was the Hilton. There are plenty of hotels in the area. Our surroundings were nothing to speak about-- We were in town for a hockey game in Aston, Pa...we were 20 minutes away and that worked fine for us--easy drive. Average room rate was $200/night for a studio, we got ours for less than $90 thanks to Priceline. I'm not 100% certain, but I think the hotel only offers Studio and 2 bedroom Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: avodoc
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2-bedroom suite. It appeared the room had had a fairly recent renovation. A nice large living area with a working fireplace. Complete kitchen with everything you need. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room was quiet despite its proximity to the airport. It featured 3 TVs, one in each bedroom and the living room and 2 complete baths. Although not exactly a garden spot, it was a very convenient place to stay to catch an early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Got My Vote”
Reviews.Author: maxma
Reviews.Content: I am at this Residence Inn as I am writing this. Hotel was renovated and was done over very nicely. There is no smoking in rooms, so no foul order. Beds and bedding are comfortable. Nice kitchen with full refrigerator, stove with oven, and microwave. Clean. Wireless internet working just fine for me. Check-in was painless. The topper though was the FREE breakfast. It was one of the best hotel breakfasts I have ever had, and I have been in many hotels in many areas, and the cook came out and actually talked to us travelers. Great! Have been to almost all the other hotels in the vicinity, but this one tops them.

Reviews.Title: “Room great, but it's the little things...”
Reviews.Author: gpmtrixie
Reviews.Content: This room was perfect for our family, almost. It was a suite with 2 bedrooms and 2 baths, kitchen and living room. We have 3 kids and it would have been perfect if we had been able to get the crib we had asked for for our baby. The rooms are nice and seem to have been recently renovated. Bathrooms were very clean, but small (separate room for toilet and tub). We had called a few days ahead of time to request a crib and were told no problem. We did not bring our pack n play on the promise of a crib. When we arrived, I asked about it and was told it would be brought to our room. Never came. I called 2 more times to ask about it and while the person at the desk was always courteous and said it would be taken care of, it never came. Baby ended up sleeping in bed with us, so not a restful night! Also, could not get internet connection to work, despite calling help line. Breakfast was pretty good...eggs, waffles, french toast, sausage, cereal, etc. So, if you don't need a crib and internet, this place is great! Good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, but not bad”
Reviews.Author: tylerarb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel one night (May 3) and found it perfectly acceptable, if not quite as nice as some other Residence Inn properties. Contrary to the experiences of other reviewers, my room was clean and in good repair. This made all of the difference in the world. Perhaps management has taken earlier criticism to heart. It also was quiet during my stay. However, signs at check-in informed guests that they were not to host "keggers" in their rooms, so I gather that the noisy, hard-drinking party crowd may frequent the place on week-ends. Also, the prominently-marked SUV for Residence Inn security was highly visible during my staff, with the guard driving from one parking area to another. That may say a lot, but there were absolutely no problems of any kind during my stay. Front desk check-in was efficient, but cold to neutral, as though the staff really would have liked to have been somewhere else, but tried to hide it (unsuccessfully). Two surprises: the room rate included not only "free" drinks and dinner, but also a "free" dinner entree (shrimp primavera pasta); and a fairly complete (and "free") breakfast buffet with scrambled eggs, bacon, hash browns, oatmail, coffee, juice, bagels, pastries, etc. There is a computer and printer in an alcove just off the lobby, which I found to be convenient for checking e-mails and for printing my boarding pass.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck! Stay away”
Reviews.Author: 4Luvmy2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property after spending 3 weeks at the Downtown Residence Inn(which is VERY nice), so I had some expectations of what to expect. When I got to the room I immediately noticed that it is seriously in need of updating. They don't use the new Marriott bedding program. There was a draft in my room so strong that it was blowing the curtains. The windows had dead bugs, cobwebs and dust. It obviously hadn't been cleaned in a very long time. I couldn't figure out where the draft was coming from so I turned up the heat and went to the closet to get the extra blanket. When I opened the package it was wet and the pillow had black mold all over it! I took a picture. I could hear EVERY footstep of the people in the room above me ALL NIGHT LONG! When they used their sink, I could here the water gurgling in my sink and my plunger even moved!!! The stove was too close to the refrigerator, so when I opened the oven door I had to lift it out of it's hinge to get it passed the refrigerator handle! Stay here if you MUST but only for a short period of time. It's not good for a long term stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, shuttle to/from airport and to train to/from center”
Reviews.Author: Haarlem
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel. Stayed here early February for 1 night (booked via priceline), having to catch an early flight (around 7:30 am) the next morning. There's a free hotel shuttle service that picks you up for the 10 minute drive to the hotel. We asked at the arrival information desk next to the airport exit to call the shuttle for us. The first shuttle starts at 5 am the next morning (free donuts & coffee available, free breakfast starts at 7 am), and they were also happy to bring us to the train station (5 minute drive) with the free shuttle. The train will get you to the city center in roughly 20 minutes for a few dollars. Room with bed, living area with tv, kitchen, and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: PageantGuru
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott Platinum member, I love Residence Inn. My business travels require that I stay in Residence Inns more than I do my own home most years. I normally have a very favorable experience. The Philadelphia Airport Residence Inn is the old style. The door to your room leads directly outside. The rooms are dirty and dusty. Needing paint and refurbishing is the least of the problem. The complete bedding, draperies, etc. need to be discarded. You can actually smell dirt and dust in those rooms. The staff is very nice and helpful. Marriott - Refurbish it or close it.

Reviews.Title: “Wet carpet among other things”
Reviews.Author: regalada
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here for work and hope I never have to stay here again. I came in on a Sunday evening, took my shoes off and landed on wet carpet that had been recently shampooed. Since I could not fathom walking about in wet carpet or wearing my shoes all night, I asked to be switched to another room. The front desk said they had nothing available. So I went back to this room and tried to work with the situation hoping the carpet would be dry the next day. It was and the next few days were uneventful except for the dishwasher coming off the cabinet and almost landing on my feet as I unloaded it (Room 213). Then today I come back to my room after work to find a sign on my door announcing wet carpet, yet again. I tore the sign off and went to the front desk to ask what possesed them to shampoo the carpet twice in five days. The front desk said they could not answer for what housekeeping did. I again asked to be switched to no avail. Then one of my co-workers told me in front of the front desk that when her carpet was shampooed they apologized to her and gave her a pair of slippers to wear. So I asked the front desk for my own pair of slippers and they told me they were in some housekeeping closet which they had no access to in the evening. I ended up borrowing the slippers from my co-worker and wearing socks with them. In a nutshell, if I'm ever sent here for work again, I will decline.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Outstanding, but No Problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Residence Inn Airport on 09/27/2004. While my experience was not bad like the others on here, this is obviously one of the earlier Residence Inns built. The furnishings and cabinetry in this location looks to be about 10-15 years old. My room was clean and quiet, but smelled like a typical smoking room. Bed was comfortable, water pressure good. However, at $159 a night, you can get a nicer place elsewhere. The Renaissance (also a Marriott property) had rates of $152 for the same night, but I opted for Residence because of their full breakfast (definitely worth the $7 differnence). Upon check-in, I had to sign a form stating that I would not have any loud parties or bring kegs on the premisis, which I thought was strange. Upon reading the other reviews, I realize now that it may have been needed.

Reviews.Title: “Worst-ever hotel experience here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 6/18/04. Filthy pool, totally overcrowded with hotel employees and their friends and families, not reserved for guests of hotel. Room was shabby, furniture stained and dirty, pillows flat and old, sheets torn, carpet dirty and wrinkled. Roaches visible in living room and bathroom. Upstairs guests over our room had a loud party until 3 a.m. and despite our two calls to management, nothing was done to stop it. Staff generally unresponsive and surly. Don't waste your money or your time here!

Reviews.Title: “Fees!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ever paid $100 for a pet fee?? You will here!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Philadelphia Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 4630 Island Avenue, Philadelphia, PA 19153
